searchDocs.title: System Overview​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO consists of several key components:  Core Tracking System: JavaScript code that collects user interaction dataData Storage: File-based and database storage for collected dataData Processing: Background processes that analyze and aggregate dataAdmin Interface: WordPress admin panels for viewing analytics and configuring the system

searchDocs.title: Core Tracking System​
searchDocs.content: The tracking system is implemented as JavaScript that is injected into WordPress pages. It:  Captures page views, clicks, scrolls, and other user interactionsSends data to the server via AJAX callsHandles user consent and privacy settings

searchDocs.title: Data Storage​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO uses a hybrid storage approach:  Raw data is stored in files in the wp-content/qa-zero-data directoryProcessed data is stored in WordPress database tablesSession recordings are stored as compressed JSON files

searchDocs.title: Data Processing​
searchDocs.content: Data processing is primarily handled by WordPress cron jobs that:  Aggregate raw data into meaningful metricsGenerate heatmaps from click and scroll dataCalculate conversion rates and other KPIs

searchDocs.title: Admin Interface​
searchDocs.content: The admin interface is integrated into the WordPress admin panel and provides:  Dashboard widgets for quick insightsDetailed reports and visualizationsConfiguration options for tracking and privacy settings

searchDocs.title: Data Flow​
searchDocs.content: User visits a page with QA ZERO tracking codeJavaScript collects interaction dataData is sent to the server via AJAXRaw data is stored in filesCron jobs process the raw dataProcessed data is stored in the databaseAdmin interface displays the processed data

searchDocs.title: Extending QA ZERO
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Creating Extensions​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO supports extensions through a simple plugin architecture:  Create a new PHP file in the extensions directoryRegister your extension using the qa_zero_register_extension functionImplement the required hooks and callbacks  Example:  <?php /** * Extension Name: My Custom Extension * Description: Adds custom functionality to QA ZERO * Version: 1.0.0 * Author: Your Name */ // Register the extension qa_zero_register_extension('my-custom-extension', array( 'title' => 'My Custom Extension', 'description' => 'Adds custom functionality to QA ZERO', 'version' => '1.0.0', 'author' => 'Your Name', 'settings' => 'my_custom_extension_settings' )); // Add settings page function my_custom_extension_settings() { // Settings page HTML } // Hook into QA ZERO add_action('qa_zero_after_track', 'my_custom_extension_callback'); // Callback function function my_custom_extension_callback($data) { // Process data }

searchDocs.title: Custom Reports​
searchDocs.content: You can create custom reports by:  Registering a new report typeImplementing the data collection functionCreating a template for displaying the report  Example:  <?php // Register custom report qa_zero_register_report('my-custom-report', array( 'title' => 'My Custom Report', 'description' => 'A custom report for QA ZERO', 'data_callback' => 'my_custom_report_data', 'template' => 'my-custom-report-template.php' )); // Data collection function function my_custom_report_data($args) { // Collect and return data return array( 'metric1' => 123, 'metric2' => 456 ); }

searchDocs.title: Custom Tracking​
searchDocs.content: You can add custom tracking by:  Adding a JavaScript file to extend the tracking functionalityRegistering the file with QA ZEROImplementing server-side handling for the custom data  Example:  <?php // Register custom tracking script qa_zero_register_script('my-custom-tracking', array( 'path' => 'js/my-custom-tracking.js', 'dependencies' => array('qa-zero-core'), 'version' => '1.0.0' )); // Handle custom tracking data add_action('wp_ajax_qa_zero_custom_track', 'my_custom_track_handler'); add_action('wp_ajax_nopriv_qa_zero_custom_track', 'my_custom_track_handler'); function my_custom_track_handler() { // Process and store custom tracking data }

searchDocs.title: What is QA ZERO?​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO is a WordPress plugin that provides analytics, heatmaps, and session recording functionality to help you understand how users interact with your website.

searchDocs.title: Is QA ZERO free?​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO offers both free and premium versions. The free version includes basic analytics and heatmap features, while the premium version adds advanced features like session recording, goal tracking, and AI-powered insights.

searchDocs.title: How does QA ZERO compare to Google Analytics?​
searchDocs.content: While Google Analytics provides comprehensive traffic data, QA ZERO focuses on user behavior and interaction. QA ZERO offers visual tools like heatmaps and session recordings that Google Analytics doesn't provide. Many users use both tools together for a complete picture of their website performance.

searchDocs.title: Does QA ZERO slow down my website?​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO is designed to have minimal impact on your website's performance. The tracking script is lightweight and loads asynchronously, meaning it doesn't block your page from loading.

searchDocs.title: Is QA ZERO GDPR compliant?​
searchDocs.content: Yes, QA ZERO includes features to help you comply with GDPR and other privacy regulations, including:  Cookie consent integrationData anonymization optionsTools for handling data subject requestsData retention controls

searchDocs.title: Search Implementation Security Review
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Implementation Choice​
searchDocs.content: For the QA ZERO documentation site, we have implemented the docusaurus-lunr-search plugin (version 3.6.0+) as the primary search solution. This choice was made based on the following security considerations:

searchDocs.title: Security Considerations​
searchDocs.content: Client-side Search: The plugin performs all search operations on the client side, eliminating the need for external API calls or server-side processing. No External Dependencies: The search functionality does not rely on external services, reducing potential attack vectors and data leakage risks. No Data Collection: Unlike some search solutions that send queries to external servers, docusaurus-lunr-search keeps all search queries and indexes local to the user's browser. Open Source: The code is open source and has been reviewed by the community, increasing the likelihood that security issues are identified and addressed. Minimal JavaScript: The plugin uses a minimal amount of JavaScript, reducing the potential attack surface.

searchDocs.title: Code Audit Results​
searchDocs.content: We conducted a thorough code audit of the docusaurus-lunr-search plugin with the following findings:  No Suspicious Code: No suspicious or malicious code was identified in the plugin. No Unnecessary Network Requests: The plugin does not make any unnecessary network requests or transmit search data to external servers. No Sensitive Data Handling: The plugin does not handle or store sensitive user data. Proper Input Sanitization: The plugin properly sanitizes search inputs to prevent XSS attacks.

searchDocs.title: Version Management​
searchDocs.content: To ensure security and stability:  Fixed Version: The plugin is locked to a specific version in package.json to prevent automatic updates that might introduce security vulnerabilities. Regular Updates: A process is in place to regularly review updates to the plugin for security improvements while maintaining version control.

searchDocs.title: Multilingual Support​
searchDocs.content: The plugin has been configured to support both English and Japanese search, with proper handling of Japanese characters and tokenization.

searchDocs.title: Option 2: Basic Search Functionality​
searchDocs.content: The built-in basic search functionality of Docusaurus was considered as a fallback option. While secure, it offers limited functionality compared to the chosen solution.

searchDocs.title: Option 3: @easyops-cn/docusaurus-search-local​
searchDocs.content: This plugin was evaluated but not selected due to security concerns:  Less active maintenanceMore complex codebase with potential security issuesPotential for unnecessary external communications

searchDocs.title: Conclusion​
searchDocs.content: Based on our security review, docusaurus-lunr-search provides the best balance of functionality and security for the QA ZERO documentation site. The plugin operates entirely client-side, does not transmit data to external servers, and has been locked to a specific version to prevent security regressions from automatic updates.

searchDocs.title: QA ZEROとは？​
searchDocs.content: QA ZEROは、簡単なインストールと管理のためにWordPressをミドルウェアとして使用する独立した分析サーバーソリューションです。利便性のためにWordPressプラグインとして配布されていますが、QA ZEROはCookieに依存せずに包括的なウェブサイト分析を提供するスタンドアロンの分析サーバーとして機能します。  従来のWordPressプラグインがWordPressの機能を拡張するのとは異なり、QA ZEROはWordPressを主にインストールフレームワークと管理インターフェースとして使用します。このアプローチにより、WordPressのコア機能とは独立して動作する強力な分析機能を提供しながら、デプロイメントが簡素化されます。

searchDocs.title: 主な機能​
searchDocs.content: 独立した分析サーバー: QA ZEROはスタンドアロンの分析ソリューションとして動作し、WordPressはデプロイメントと管理レイヤーとして機能します。100％Cookieレストラッキング: Cookieや個人識別子を使用せずに意味のある分析を取得します。デフォルトでセルフホスト: あなたのデータを所有します。QA ZEROは完全にあなたのインフラストラクチャ上で実行され、外部サーバーは必要ありません。AI搭載インサイト（オプション）: オプションのAIエージェントで分析とオートメーションを強化します。ヒートマップとセッション記録: ユーザーの行動を視覚化し、実際のユーザージャーニーを再生します。コンバージョン目標トラッキング: サイト上の重要なユーザーアクションを定義し監視します。高速、軽量、プライバシー優先: パフォーマンスとコンプライアンスを念頭に置いて構築されています。

searchDocs.title: アーキテクチャの概要​
searchDocs.content: QA ZEROは3つの主要コンポーネントで構成されています：  WordPress統合レイヤー: インストール、設定を処理し、管理インターフェースを提供します。分析サーバーコア: 訪問者データを処理および分析する独立エンジン。データ収集スクリプト: ウェブサイト上のユーザーインタラクションをキャプチャする軽量JavaScript。  このアーキテクチャにより、QA ZEROはインストールと管理の容易さのためにWordPressを活用しながら、強力な分析機能を提供することができます。

searchDocs.title: Heatmap Usage
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Accessing Heatmap Functionality​
searchDocs.content: Since QA ZERO is an independent analytics server that uses WordPress as middleware, heatmaps are accessed through the Analytics interface:  Log in to your WordPress admin dashboardNavigate to QA ZERO > Analytics in the main menuSelect the Heatmaps tab in the analytics interface

searchDocs.title: Types of Heatmaps​
searchDocs.content: The QA ZERO analytics server processes visitor data to generate several types of heatmaps:

searchDocs.title: Click Heatmaps​
searchDocs.content: Click heatmaps show where users click on your page. Areas with more clicks appear "hotter" (red/orange), while areas with fewer clicks appear "cooler" (blue/green).    Use click heatmaps to:  Identify which elements attract the most attentionDiscover if users are clicking on non-clickable elementsOptimize the placement of important links and buttons

searchDocs.title: Scroll Heatmaps​
searchDocs.content: Scroll heatmaps show how far users scroll down your page. The color gradient indicates the percentage of users who reached each part of the page.    Use scroll heatmaps to:  Determine if users see important content below the foldIdentify the optimal placement for key informationImprove page layout to encourage deeper scrolling

searchDocs.title: Move Heatmaps​
searchDocs.content: Move heatmaps track mouse movement patterns, showing where users hover their cursor.    Use move heatmaps to:  Understand what content attracts user attentionIdentify areas that users find interesting but may not click onOptimize the placement of important information

searchDocs.title: Configuring Heatmap Analysis​
searchDocs.content: To configure which pages to analyze with heatmaps:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Analytics in the main menuSelect the Heatmaps tabClick Configure TrackingSelect the pages you want to track: Specific URLURL pattern (using wildcards)Page type (homepage, posts, pages, etc.) Set the data collection periodClick Save Configuration  The analytics server will then begin collecting and processing data for the specified pages.

searchDocs.title: Viewing and Analyzing Heatmaps​
searchDocs.content: To view and analyze your heatmaps:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Analytics in the main menuSelect the Heatmaps tabChoose the page you want to analyze from the listUse the date range selector to filter data by time periodUse the device filter to view data for specific devices (desktop, tablet, mobile)Use the visitor segment filter to analyze behavior of specific user groups

searchDocs.title: Interpreting Heatmap Data​
searchDocs.content: When analyzing heatmaps, look for:  Hot spots: Areas with high user engagement (red/orange)Cold spots: Areas with low user engagement (blue/green)Unexpected patterns: Clicks on non-clickable elements or unusual scroll patternsFold line: The point where users need to scroll to see more contentEngagement drop-offs: Points where user engagement significantly decreases

searchDocs.title: Comparing Heatmaps​
searchDocs.content: The analytics server allows you to compare heatmaps to identify changes in user behavior:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Analytics in the main menuSelect the Heatmaps tabChoose the page you want to analyzeClick Compare PeriodsSelect two different time periods to compareUse the comparison view to see differences between the two periods

searchDocs.title: Exporting Heatmap Data​
searchDocs.content: To export heatmap data for reporting or further analysis:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Analytics in the main menuSelect the Heatmaps tabChoose the page you want to export data forClick ExportChoose your preferred format (PNG, PDF, CSV)Click Download

searchDocs.title: Best Practices​
searchDocs.content: Collect data for at least 1,000 page views to ensure statistical significanceCreate separate analyses for desktop and mobile usersCompare heatmaps before and after making changes to your websiteUse heatmaps in conjunction with other analytics data for a complete pictureRegularly review heatmaps to identify optimization opportunities

searchDocs.title: Heatmap Overlay Misalignment​
searchDocs.content: The most common theme-related issue is misalignment between the heatmap overlay and the actual website content.    Possible causes:  Dynamic Content: Elements that load after the initial page load (sliders, lazy-loaded images)Responsive Layouts: Themes that significantly alter layout across different screen sizesCustom Positioning: Elements with absolute or fixed positioningiFrames: Content loaded within iFrames

searchDocs.title: Solution Steps​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > AdvancedEnable Delayed Tracking and set the delay to 2-3 secondsEnable Enhanced Element TrackingSave changes and test the heatmap again  For persistent issues:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > AdvancedIn the Custom Code section, add the following JavaScript: window.qaZeroConfig = { adjustForDynamicContent: true, trackingDelay: 2500, resizeThrottle: 500 }; Save changes and test the heatmap again

searchDocs.content: はい、特定のユーザーロール、ログインしているユーザー、または特定のIPアドレスをトラッキングから除外するようにQA ZEROを設定できます。これらのオプションは管理インターフェースの「分析設定」セクションで利用できます。

searchDocs.title: ウェブサイトにコードを追加する必要がありますか？​
searchDocs.pageTitle: よくある質問（スタートガイド）
searchDocs.url: /ja/docs/user-manual/start-guide/faq#ウェブサイトにコードを追加する必要がありますか
searchDocs.content: いいえ、QA ZEROをWordPressを通じて有効にすると、必要なトラッキングコードが自動的にウェブサイトに追加されます。WordPress統合レイヤーがこれを処理するため、手動でコードを挿入する必要はありません。

searchDocs.title: QA ZEROはGDPRに準拠していますか？​
searchDocs.pageTitle: よくある質問（スタートガイド）
searchDocs.content: はい、QA ZEROにはGDPRやその他のプライバシー規制に準拠するための機能が含まれています：  IP匿名化Cookie同意統合データ保持コントロールデータエクスポートと削除ツール

searchDocs.title: QA ZEROはCookieを使用しますか？​
searchDocs.pageTitle: よくある質問（スタートガイド）
searchDocs.content: QA ZEROはCookieに依存せずに動作するように設計されています。訪問者のデバイスに情報を保存する必要のない代替トラッキング方法を使用します。これにより、包括的な分析を提供しながらプライバシー規制に準拠することが容易になります。

searchDocs.title: 訪問者はトラッキングをオプトアウトできますか？​
searchDocs.pageTitle: よくある質問（スタートガイド）
searchDocs.url: /ja/docs/user-manual/start-guide/faq#訪問者はトラッキングをオプトアウトできますか
searchDocs.content: はい、Cookie同意ソリューションを使用している場合、訪問者はトラッキングをオプトアウトできます。QA ZEROは訪問者のプライバシー設定を尊重し、オプトアウトしたユーザーを追跡しません。

searchDocs.title: Initial Setup
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Understanding the Setup Process​
searchDocs.content: The initial setup configures both the WordPress integration layer and the underlying analytics server. While you'll be interacting with the setup through the WordPress admin interface, you're actually configuring an independent analytics system that operates alongside WordPress.

searchDocs.title: Accessing QA ZERO Management Interface​
searchDocs.content: Log in to your WordPress admin dashboardNavigate to QA ZERO in the main menuClick on Analytics Settings to access the configuration options

searchDocs.title: General Settings​
searchDocs.content: Enable Analytics Server: Toggle this option to start the analytics server and begin data collectionServer Resources: Configure how much of your server resources the analytics engine can utilizeTrack Logged-in Users: Choose whether to track users who are logged in to your WordPress siteData Retention Period: Select how long to keep collected data (30 days, 90 days, 180 days, 1 year, or forever)Save Changes: Click the Save button to apply your settings

searchDocs.title: Privacy Settings​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO is designed with privacy in mind and complies with regulations like GDPR and CCPA:  IP Anonymization: Enable to anonymize visitor IP addressesPersonal Data Collection: Configure what personal data is collected, if anyData Processing Location: Specify where analytics data should be processed and storedSave Changes: Click the Save button to apply your settings

searchDocs.title: Setting Up Data Collection​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > Analytics in the main menuIn the Data Collection tab, configure which pages and interactions to trackSet up event tracking for specific user actions (clicks, form submissions, etc.)Configure conversion goals if neededSave your settings

searchDocs.title: Viewing Analytics Data​
searchDocs.content: The analytics data is accessible through the Analytics dashboard:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Analytics DashboardView real-time data in the dashboardAccess heatmaps and other visualization tools through the Analytics interface

searchDocs.title: Verifying Server Operation​
searchDocs.content: After completing the initial setup:  Visit your website as a normal userPerform some actions (click links, scroll, etc.)Return to the QA ZERO analytics dashboardCheck the server status indicator to ensure the analytics server is running properlyVerify that data is being collected in the Analytics section  Note that it may take a few minutes for data to appear in your dashboard as the analytics server processes the information.

searchDocs.title: Next Steps​
searchDocs.content: Now that you've completed the initial setup of your analytics server, explore the following features:  Screens and Operations OverviewHeatmap UsageArticle Data Analysis

searchDocs.title: インストール
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: インストールプロセスについて理解する​
searchDocs.url: /ja/docs/user-manual/start-guide/installation#インストールプロセスについて理解する
searchDocs.content: QA ZEROは利便性のためにWordPressプラグインとして配布されていますが、WordPressをミドルウェアとして使用する独立した分析サーバーをインストールしていることを理解することが重要です。WordPressプラグイン形式は、基盤となる分析サーバーの簡単なインストールと管理インターフェースを提供するだけです。

searchDocs.title: システム要件​
searchDocs.content: QA ZEROをインストールする前に、システムが以下の要件を満たしていることを確認してください：  WordPress 5.5以上PHP 7.4以上MySQL 5.6以上モダンウェブブラウザ（Chrome、Firefox、Safari、Edge）分析サーバーを実行するための十分なサーバーリソース（最低1GB RAMを推奨）

searchDocs.title: 方法1：WordPressプラグインディレクトリからインストール​
searchDocs.url: /ja/docs/user-manual/start-guide/installation#方法1wordpressプラグインディレクトリからインストール
searchDocs.content: WordPressの管理ダッシュボードにログインしますプラグイン > 新規追加に移動します「QA ZERO」を検索しますQA ZEROプラグインの横にある今すぐインストールをクリックしますインストールが完了したら、有効化をクリックします

searchDocs.title: 方法2：手動インストール​
searchDocs.content: 当社のウェブサイトまたはWordPressプラグインディレクトリからQA ZEROプラグインのZIPファイルをダウンロードしますWordPressの管理ダッシュボードにログインしますプラグイン > 新規追加に移動しますページ上部のプラグインのアップロードボタンをクリックしますファイルを選択をクリックし、ダウンロードしたQA ZERO ZIPファイルを選択します今すぐインストールをクリックしますインストールが完了したら、有効化をクリックします

searchDocs.title: インストール中に何が起こるか​
searchDocs.url: /ja/docs/user-manual/start-guide/installation#インストール中に何が起こるか
searchDocs.content: QA ZEROを有効化すると、以下のコンポーネントがセットアップされます：  WordPress統合レイヤー：WordPress管理画面内に管理インターフェースを作成します分析サーバーコア：訪問者データを処理する独立した分析エンジンをインストールしますデータ収集スクリプト：ウェブサイトに必要なトラッキングコードを追加します

searchDocs.title: インストールの確認​
searchDocs.content: QA ZEROが正しくインストールされたことを確認するには：  WordPressの管理ダッシュボードで、「QA ZERO」というラベルの新しいメニュー項目が表示されるはずですQA ZEROメニューをクリックして分析ダッシュボードにアクセスしますサーバーステータス情報を含むQA ZEROウェルカム画面が表示されるはずです    QA ZEROメニューが表示されない、またはエラーが発生した場合は、トラブルシューティングセクションを参照してください。

searchDocs.title: 次のステップ​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO分析サーバーのインストールが成功したら、初期設定ガイドに進んで分析環境を設定します。

searchDocs.title: Troubleshooting Data Loss
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Complete Data Loss​
searchDocs.content: Complete data loss occurs when all historical data disappears from your QA ZERO dashboard.  Possible causes:  Database Reset: Accidental use of the "Reset Data" functionPlugin Reinstallation: Uninstalling and reinstalling the plugin without proper backupDatabase Corruption: Server issues affecting the WordPress database

searchDocs.title: Partial Data Loss​
searchDocs.content: Partial data loss occurs when some data is missing for specific time periods or pages.  Possible causes:  Tracking Interruption: Temporary issues with the tracking scriptData Processing Errors: Background processing failuresData Retention Settings: Automatic deletion of older dataContent Filtering: Exclusion rules preventing data collection

searchDocs.title: Check Data Collection Status​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > DashboardLook for the Data Collection Status indicatorIf it shows "Active," data collection is currently working

searchDocs.title: Verify Recent Data​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > AnalyticsSet the date range to "Today" or "Yesterday"Check if recent data is being recordedIf recent data exists but historical data is missing, the issue is likely with stored data rather than collection

searchDocs.title: Check Database Status​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > Tools > DatabaseRun a Database Integrity CheckNote any errors or warnings

searchDocs.title: Review System Logs​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > Tools > LogsLook for errors related to data processing or storageNote the timestamps of any relevant errors

searchDocs.title: Data Retention Settings​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO automatically removes old data based on your retention settings:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > DataCheck the Data Retention Period settingIf set to a short period (e.g., 30 days), older data will be automatically deletedAdjust the setting to a longer period if neededNote that changing this setting will not restore already deleted data

searchDocs.title: Database Issues​
searchDocs.content: Database corruption can cause data loss:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Tools > DatabaseRun Optimize Tables to repair and optimize the databaseIf issues persist, run Repair Tables  For severe database issues:  Check your server's error logs for database-related errorsContact your hosting provider for assistance with database repairRestore from a backup if available

searchDocs.title: Tracking Script Issues​
searchDocs.content: If the tracking script was temporarily disabled or broken:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > TrackingVerify that tracking is enabledCheck the Script Status indicatorIf it shows "Warning" or "Error," click on the status for more information

searchDocs.title: Plugin Conflicts​
searchDocs.content: Other plugins may interfere with QA ZERO's data collection or storage:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Tools > DiagnosticsRun a Plugin Compatibility CheckReview any conflicts detectedResolve conflicts by updating or reconfiguring the conflicting plugins

searchDocs.title: Server Resource Limitations​
searchDocs.content: Limited server resources can prevent data processing:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Tools > System InfoCheck the Server Resources sectionIf values are below recommended levels, contact your hosting provider about upgrading

searchDocs.title: From Backup​
searchDocs.content: If you have a backup of your WordPress database:  Restore the database from backupNavigate to QA ZERO > Tools > DatabaseRun Sync Data to ensure consistency

searchDocs.title: Using Data Recovery Tool​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO includes a data recovery tool for some scenarios:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Tools > RecoveryClick Scan for Recoverable DataIf recoverable data is found, click Recover DataFollow the prompts to complete the recovery process

searchDocs.title: From Local Storage​
searchDocs.content: In some cases, data may still exist in visitors' browsers:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > AdvancedEnable Local Storage RecoverySave changesThis will attempt to recover data from returning visitors' browsers

searchDocs.title: Regular Backups​
searchDocs.content: Set up regular backups of your WordPress database:  Use a backup plugin like UpdraftPlus or BackupBuddySchedule daily or weekly backupsStore backups in a secure, off-site location

searchDocs.title: Optimal Settings​
searchDocs.content: Configure QA ZERO for reliable data collection:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > PerformanceEnable Reliable Data Mode (may slightly increase server load)Set Processing Frequency to "More Frequent"Save changes

searchDocs.title: Monitoring​
searchDocs.content: Set up monitoring to detect issues early:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > NotificationsEnable Data Collection AlertsEnter your email addressSelect alert conditions (e.g., "No data collected for 24 hours")Save changes

searchDocs.title: Getting Support​
searchDocs.content: If you've tried the troubleshooting steps above and still have issues:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Tools > System InfoClick Copy System InfoContact QA ZERO support with: Your system informationDescription of the data lossTime period affectedSteps you've already taken to troubleshoot

searchDocs.title: Troubleshooting License Errors
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Invalid License Key​
searchDocs.content: If you see an "Invalid License Key" error:    Possible causes:  Typo in License Key: The license key was entered incorrectlyExpired License: The license has expired and needs renewalRevoked License: The license has been revoked due to terms violation

searchDocs.title: License Activation Limit Reached​
searchDocs.content: If you see a "License Activation Limit Reached" error:    This means you've activated the license on the maximum number of sites allowed by your license tier.

searchDocs.title: Connection Error​
searchDocs.content: If you see a "Connection Error" when trying to activate or verify your license:    This indicates that your WordPress site cannot connect to the QA ZERO license server.

searchDocs.title: License Deactivated Unexpectedly​
searchDocs.content: If your previously activated license shows as deactivated:    This can occur if the license was deactivated from another location or if there are connectivity issues.

searchDocs.title: Verify License Key​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > LicenseCheck the license key for typos or extra spacesRe-enter the license key if necessaryClick Activate License

searchDocs.title: Check License Status​
searchDocs.content: Log in to your QA ZERO account at https://qazero.com/account/Go to the Licenses sectionCheck the status, expiration date, and activation count of your licenseIf expired, renew your license

searchDocs.title: Deactivate Unused Sites​
searchDocs.content: If you've reached your activation limit:  Log in to your QA ZERO account at https://qazero.com/account/Go to the Licenses sectionView the list of sites where your license is activatedClick Deactivate next to sites you no longer needReturn to your WordPress site and activate the license again

searchDocs.title: Fix Connection Issues​
searchDocs.content: If you're experiencing connection errors:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Tools > System InfoCheck the Connectivity sectionVerify that your site can connect to qazero.com  If connection issues are detected:  Check if your server has outbound connection restrictionsTemporarily disable any security plugins or firewallsContact your hosting provider to ensure they don't block outbound connections

searchDocs.title: Manual License Activation​
searchDocs.content: If automatic activation fails, you can try manual activation:  Navigate to QA ZERO > LicenseClick Manual ActivationCopy the site key displayedLog in to your QA ZERO accountGo to the Manual Activation sectionPaste your site key and generate an activation codeCopy the activation code and paste it back in your WordPress siteClick Activate License

searchDocs.title: Understanding License Tiers​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO offers several license tiers:  Tier	Sites	Features	SupportFree	1	Basic analytics, limited heatmaps	Community forum Personal	1	Full analytics, all heatmap types	Email support Business	3	All features + advanced reporting	Priority support Agency	10	All features + white labeling	Dedicated support

searchDocs.title: Upgrading Your License​
searchDocs.content: To upgrade your license:  Log in to your QA ZERO account at https://qazero.com/account/Go to the Licenses sectionClick Upgrade next to your current licenseSelect the new license tierComplete the checkout processYour license will be automatically upgraded

searchDocs.title: Downgrading Your License​
searchDocs.content: To downgrade your license:  Wait until your current license expiresPurchase the lower-tier licenseActivate the new license on your site  Note that downgrading may result in loss of access to certain features.

searchDocs.title: Automatic Renewal​
searchDocs.content: By default, QA ZERO licenses are set to renew automatically:  You will receive email notifications before the renewal dateThe renewal will use the payment method on fileYour license will continue without interruption

searchDocs.title: Manual Renewal​
searchDocs.content: If you've disabled automatic renewal:  Log in to your QA ZERO account at https://qazero.com/account/Go to the Licenses sectionClick Renew next to the expiring licenseComplete the checkout process

searchDocs.title: Renewal Discounts​
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO offers renewal discounts:  15% discount for 1-year renewals25% discount for 2-year renewals35% discount for 3-year renewals

searchDocs.title: Transferring Licenses​
searchDocs.content: To transfer a license to a different site:  Deactivate the license on the current siteNavigate to QA ZERO > License on the new siteEnter your license keyClick Activate License

searchDocs.title: Getting Support for License Issues​
searchDocs.content: If you continue to experience license issues:  Check the QA ZERO Knowledge Base for license-related articlesContact QA ZERO support with: Your license key (last 4 characters only for security)Description of the issueScreenshots of any error messagesSteps you've already taken to troubleshoot

searchDocs.title: Troubleshooting Recording Issues
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: No Data Being Recorded​
searchDocs.content: If you're not seeing any data in your QA ZERO dashboard:  Verify Tracking is Enabled​  Navigate to QA ZERO > SettingsEnsure the Enable Tracking option is turned onSave changes if needed  Check Script Installation​  Visit your website in an incognito/private browsing windowRight-click and select "View Page Source"Search for "qa-zero" in the source codeVerify the tracking script is present in the <head> or before the closing </body> tag    If the script is missing:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > AdvancedTry changing the Script Insertion Method to a different optionSave changes and check your site again  Check for JavaScript Errors​  Open your website in Chrome or FirefoxOpen the browser's developer tools (F12 or right-click > Inspect)Go to the Console tabLook for any errors related to QA ZERO  If you see errors:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > AdvancedEnable Debug ModeSave changes and reload your siteCheck the console for more detailed error information

searchDocs.title: Partial Data Recording​
searchDocs.content: If some data is being recorded but not all:  Check Tracking Configuration​  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > TrackingVerify that all desired tracking options are enabled: Page ViewsClicksScrollingForm Interactionsetc. Save changes if needed  Check Content Filtering​  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > ContentReview the Excluded Pages and Excluded Content Types settingsEnsure you haven't accidentally excluded content you want to trackSave changes if needed

searchDocs.title: Heatmap Not Displaying Correctly​
searchDocs.content: If heatmaps are not displaying correctly on your pages:  Check Page Compatibility​  Navigate to QA ZERO > HeatmapsClick on the problematic heatmapClick Compatibility CheckReview any issues detected and follow the suggested solutions  Adjust Heatmap Settings​  Navigate to QA ZERO > HeatmapsClick on the problematic heatmapClick SettingsTry adjusting the following: Tracking Delay: Increase to 2-3 seconds for dynamic contentElement Tracking Method: Try alternative methodsViewport Detection: Adjust based on your theme Save changes and check the heatmap again

searchDocs.title: Chrome​
searchDocs.content: If recording issues occur specifically in Chrome:  Check if any ad blockers or privacy extensions are installedVerify that third-party cookies are allowedTry disabling any content blocking features

searchDocs.title: Safari​
searchDocs.content: Safari's Intelligent Tracking Prevention (ITP) can affect analytics:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > AdvancedEnable Safari Compatibility ModeSave changes

searchDocs.title: Firefox​
searchDocs.content: If recording issues occur specifically in Firefox:  Check if Enhanced Tracking Protection is blocking QA ZERONavigate to QA ZERO > Settings > AdvancedEnable Firefox Compatibility ModeSave changes

searchDocs.title: Plugin Conflict Resolution​
searchDocs.content: If you suspect a plugin conflict:  Temporarily deactivate other plugins one by oneAfter each deactivation, check if QA ZERO recording worksIf you identify a conflicting plugin, check the Plugin Compatibility section for specific guidance

searchDocs.title: PHP Settings​
searchDocs.content: Ensure your server meets these requirements:  PHP 7.4 or higherMemory limit: 128MB or higherMax execution time: 30 seconds or higherPOST max size: 8MB or higher

searchDocs.title: WordPress Configuration​
searchDocs.content: Check these WordPress settings:  Ensure WordPress address (URL) and Site address (URL) are correctly set in Settings > GeneralVerify that permalink settings are configured and working

searchDocs.title: Enable Debug Logging​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > AdvancedEnable Debug ModeSet Log Level to "Verbose"Save changesPerform the actions that aren't being recordedNavigate to QA ZERO > Tools > LogsReview the logs for error messages or warnings

searchDocs.title: Manual Script Verification​
searchDocs.content: Add this code to your theme's header.php file (before the closing </head> tag) to force the tracking script:  <?php if (function_exists('qahm_zero_print_tracking_code')) { qahm_zero_print_tracking_code(); } ?>

searchDocs.title: Database Check​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > Tools > DatabaseRun Database Integrity CheckIf issues are found, use the Repair Tables option

searchDocs.title: Getting Support​
searchDocs.content: If you've tried the troubleshooting steps above and still have issues:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Tools > System InfoClick Copy System InfoContact QA ZERO support with: Your system informationDescription of the issueSteps you've already taken to troubleshootScreenshots of any error messages
